intro: Halimium ocymoides f. sampsucifolium, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crambeae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to rocky and sandy soils in southern Europe. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and succulent, adapted to arid conditions. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in rock gardens and dry landscapes.
